entities.description: Designation code for indicating there is nobody to talk to about serious problems.
Survey item asking if there's nobody the respondent can talk to about serious problems.
Survey item asking if the respondent can talk to their mother or father about serious problems.
Survey item asking if the respondent can talk to their boyfriend or girlfriend about serious problems.
Survey item asking if the respondent can talk to some other adult about serious problems.
Survey item asking if the respondent can talk to some other person about serious problems.
The type of response entered by the survey participant.
Indicator that a response was not entered by the survey participant.
Specific response codes used to categorize the type of response entered.
The number of times specific responses were recorded.
The percentage representation of specific responses among all responses.

relationships.description: Associates the survey question about having nobody to talk to with a response type.
Indicates whether the respondent did not provide a response for the item about having nobody to talk to.
Links a specific response to its categorized response codes.
Indicates the frequency of a specific response code.
Indicates the percentage of a specific response code among all responses.
